rules: Rule1: If an artwork is included in the exhibition, then it meets the standards or does not violate the guidelines.
Rule2: Provided that the catalog features the artwork, the artwork is included in the exhibition.
Rule3: Whenever a visitor purchases the catalog, they attend the exhibition.
Rule4: If the critic reviews the exhibition, then the visitor purchases the catalog.
Rule5: In the event that the exhibition opens on the date, the artist does not withdraw from the exhibition.
Rule6: The exhibition runs for the period only if it opens on the date.
Rule7: Whenever the exhibition closes on the date, it is extended for the period.
Rule8: Provided that the exhibition is extended for the period, it runs for the period.
Rule9: If the museum organizes the exhibition, then when the committee approves the artwork, displaying the artwork in the exhibition leads to the exhibition being successful.
Rule10: Provided that the artist participates in the exhibition, the critic reviews the exhibition.
Rule11: Whenever the artist participates in the exhibition, they withdraw from the exhibition.
Rule12: If the artist participates in the exhibition, then it is not the case that the visitor attends the exhibition.
Rule13: Either the artist participates in the exhibition or, if the exhibition is not successful, the gallery receives funding from the sponsor.
Rule14: In the event that the corporation sponsors the exhibition, then when the committee approves the artwork, displaying the artwork in the exhibition results in the exhibition being successful.
Rule15: If the media promotes the exhibition, then either the museum organizes the exhibition or the corporation sponsors the exhibition.
Rule16: Either the group protests the exhibition or the media promotes the exhibition.
Rule17: Provided that the authority censors the artwork, the artwork does not violate the guidelines.
Rule18: If the curator removes the artwork, then the artwork does not violate the guidelines.
Rule19: The artwork creates a scandal only if it generates publicity.
Rule20: Whenever the artwork wins an award, it meets the standards.
Rule21: Provided that the artwork is rejected, it does not violate the guidelines.
Rule22: If the jury selects the artwork, then either the artwork wins an award or it is rejected.
Rule23: Either the jury selects the artwork or the panel nominates the artwork.
Rule24: If the panel nominates the artwork, then the artwork is shortlisted.
Rule25: Provided that the artwork is shortlisted, then either it wins an award or it is rejected.
Rule26: Either the artwork is featured in the exhibition or it is not excluded from the exhibition.
Rule27: If the artist accepts the invitation to the exhibition, then they do not withdraw from the exhibition.
Rule28: Either the artist accepts the invitation to the exhibition or they decline the invitation to the exhibition.
Rule29: Whenever the artist declines the invitation to the exhibition, they do not withdraw from the exhibition.
Rule30: If it is not the case that either the authority censors the artwork or the curator removes the artwork, then the artwork creates a scandal.

Rule31: If it is not the case that the committee approving the artwork implies that displaying the artwork in the exhibition leads to the exhibition being successful, then the artwork violates the guidelines.
Rule32: In the event that the artwork is not included in the exhibition, then it is excluded from the exhibition.
facts: Fact1: The catalog features the artwork.
Fact2: The exhibition closes on the date.
Fact3: The artwork is displayed in the exhibition.
Fact4: The committee approves the artwork.
Fact5: It is not the case that the gallery receives funding from the sponsor.
Fact6: It is not the case that the group protests the exhibition.
Fact7: It is not the case that the artwork generates publicity.
Fact8: It is not the case that the artwork is featured in the exhibition.
Fact9: It is not the case that the artwork meets the standards.
